This article discusses the rise of Generative AI, a type of artificial intelligence that can create new content like text, images, and audio. It explains the mathematical principles behind Generative AI and provides a model-, system-, and application-level view of the technology. The article also examines the socio-technical implications of Generative AI, including its impact on human-AI interaction and the rise of hybrid intelligence. 

The authors then discuss four key limitations of current Generative AI: incorrect outputs, bias and fairness, copyright violation, and environmental concerns. Finally, they explore the implications of Generative AI for the Business & Information Systems Engineering (BISE) community, outlining research opportunities in areas like business process management, decision analytics, digital business management, economics of information systems, enterprise modeling, human-computer interaction, and information systems engineering.
